alert.note: Alert for Denver; Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 4:40PM MDT until June 29 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHWEST DENVER COUNTIES... At 440 PM MDT, Radar indicated that thunderstorms with torrential rain and hail had moved out of the immediate Flash Flood Warning area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain had fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters and broadcast media reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Northwestern Denver, northeastern Lakewood, southeastern Arvada, southern Commerce City, eastern Wheat Ridge, Edgewater and Mountain View. Flash flooding was earlier reported at 23rd avenue and I-25 in Denver, as well as I70 near the Federal Boulevard overpass. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Excessive runoff from this storm will cause flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets, underpasses, drainage areas and other low lying spots.
